node.title: Confidence in Americans' Election Day Choices Plummets Among Independents, Republicans
node.description: Just 37 percent of independents and 46 percent of GOP voters said they now have faith in Election Day choices.

node.title: A Tool Kit to Help Scientists Find the Ultimate Chickpea
node.description: A major plant genome sequencing effort may offer a path to breeding more climate-resilient chickpeas, while also revealing clues to the legume’s origins.

node.title: My Father Was a Black Photojournalist When There Were So Few
node.description: The writer Aisha Sabatini Sloan and her father, a photojournalist, wrote a book together, “Captioning the Archives.”

node.title: Trying a More Reliable At-Home COVID-19 Molecular Test from Cue
node.description: Cue Health developed an over-the-counter COVID-19 test that is more reliable than an antigen test. Here's what it's like to use.

node.title: Shameless Scammers Fleeced Wealthy Seniors They Were Supposed To Be Caring For
node.description: Pair targeted victims with no family; one victim lost her home, her investments and cash.

node.title: Donald Trump Strongly Hints at 2024 Run as Multiple Polls Show Him Beating Biden
node.description: Although both Trump's and Biden's favorability remains low, several recent polls have shown the former president favored to win the next presidential election.

node.title: 'Employee of the Year' Upset by 1 Percent Pay Rise Supported by Internet
node.description: The worker shared that he received the same pay increase as the rest of the company, despite going "above and beyond" and receiving the yearly award.

node.title: Riot declared in Portland as Kyle Rittenhouse acquittal sparks some protests
node.description: Outside the city of Kenosha, 500 National Guard troops remain on standby.

node.title: Why Are There So Many Premature Births in America?
node.description: This shouldn’t happen in a wealthy nation.

node.title: Exonerations Only Deepen Mystery Shrouding Malcolm X’s Killing
node.description: Scholars have never accepted the official explanation for the murder. That is unlikely to change.

node.title: Giant Prehistoric Shark Teeth From 60-Foot Ocean Monster Unearthed in Desert
node.description: A single tooth from this fearsome megalodon predator is bigger than a man's hand.

node.title: Disallowed goals see Daniel Sturridge's A-League Men debut end in 1-1 draw
node.description: In front of a crowd of more than 17,000, the former Liverpool and England striker had 10 minutes at the end to try and snatch victory for the home side.

node.title: Chinese state media says Peng Shuai will appear 'soon', amid speculation over missing tennis star
node.description: Chinese state media employees post photos of missing sportswoman Peng Shuai, saying she is at home and "didn't want to be disturbed".

node.title: Mick Rock, Sought-After Rock Photographer, Dies at 72
node.description: His images of David Bowie, Lou Reed, Queen and others helped define the 1970s. He was still shooting the stars decades later.

node.title: Adding Surprise to Your Reading Life
node.description: Our critic recommends old and new books.

node.title: Ray Dalio Says ‘If You Worry, You Don’t Have to Worry’
node.description: The billionaire founder of the world’s largest hedge fund talked with DealBook about China, inflation and “The Changing World Order,” his new book about empires.

node.title: Internet Backs Mom After Mother-in-Law, Husband Veto Her Favorite Baby Name
node.description: The woman revealed her top choice was Raphael, and had considered Rafferty, so her son could still have the nickname Rafe or Raffi.

node.title: 10 Historical Questions That Can Get You Arrested in China
node.description: Telephone and online hotlines allow citizens to report others who talk about these 10 "rumours."

node.title: New Volcanoes Could Emerge Anywhere In US Southwest, Study Says
node.description: Volcanic fields pepper the southwestern U.S., posing a risk of new eruptions that could cause widespread devastation.

node.title: Austria braces for violence at mass protests over Covid measures.
node.description: The police in Vienna said that 10 of 11 demonstrations registered for Saturday involved protests over rules including a newly announced lockdown and vaccine requirement.

node.title: Dog Hailed a Hero After Surviving Bullet in Head Confronting Armed Intruder
node.description: Gus has been made an honorary police canine after being shot in the head by a convicted felon in his Tennessee backyard.

node.title: Diving save ensures goalless Sydney derby, Tony Popovic gets winning start as Victory boss
node.description: A long-range strike from Wanderers' former England international Jack Rodwell nearly sends the boisterous crowd of 23,118 into raptures during the tight derby.

node.title: U.S. Tries to Convince Arab Allies It Isn’t Abandoning Them
node.description: The defense secretary faced tough questions about how countries were supposed to deal with a U.S. national security policy that upends itself with each president.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Lawyer Says 'There's Too Many Guns in Our Society'
node.description: Attorney Mark Richards told CNN's Chris Cuomo "I'm old enough when I remember you couldn't carry a gun."

node.title: Singapore will begin easing its Covid restrictions next week.
node.description: The Southeast Asian city state is recovering from a recent surge of hospitalizations. An official said its reopening would proceed in a “step-by-step manner.”

node.title: How to Get a Coronavirus Booster Shot in New York City
node.description: New Yorkers can get coronavirus vaccine booster shots at a number of places, including pop-up vans, churches, local pharmacies and community health clinics.

node.title: Inside Fentanyl’s Mounting Death Toll: ‘This Is Poison’
node.description: While a rise in overdose deaths shows the devastating consequences of the opioid’s spread, less is understood about how the drug has proliferated.

node.title: ‘When Are You Getting Married?’
node.description: The holiday season can sometimes lead to uncomfortable quizzing from meddlesome friends and family members about when you and your partner plan to wed. Here’s how to respond.

node.title: The Godmother of ‘Plant-Based’ Living
node.description: Frances Moore Lappé, the author of “Diet for a Small Planet,” which was published 50 years ago and spurred a movement toward vegetarianism, looks back on her legacy.

node.title: To Breed or Not to Breed?
node.description: In a world of pandemic chaos, political strife and climate catastrophe, some would-be parents see the future as too dark to procreate.
